Why scientists are divided over whether there is a 'sixth mass extinction'
subhead: American researchers have reignited the debate over the concept by publishing an article that questions the idea of a new mass extinction event that is comparable in scale to the one that wiped out the dinosaurs.

Texas Republicans to pass voting map that reignited US redistricting wars
subhead: There is little Democrats in Texas can do to thwart the map, but it has prompted retaliation in California, and serious discussions in other Democratic states alarmed that the Texas maneuver could be replicated nationwide.

headline: In China, the electric car sector is facing the challenge of overcapacity
subhead: With the domestic market saturated and undergoing major changes, auto giant BYD's sales are dropping. Now, it is relying on exports to weather the storm.

headline: La Piscine in Roubaix invites visitors to take a plunge into culture
subhead: 'Strange places for an exhibition' (3/6). Le Monde explores six art centers housed in unique locations. Today: an Art Deco building transformed in 2001 into La Piscine Museum of Art and Industry in northern France.

headline: On the 'art of shunning' – and the risks that come with it
subhead: 'Letters from America' (4/6). Writer and journalist Thomas Chatterton Williams considers the dangers of cancel culture and 'wokeness.' It is better to engage in dialogue, even if it is difficult, in the real world than to 'punish and ostracize' on social media, he says.

France faces prospect of paying higher borrowing costs than Italy
subhead: Rome has significantly reduced its public deficit over the past three years, while Paris has allowed its own to spiral. In the eyes of investors, Italy is now as credible as France, despite a heavier debt burden. On the markets, the gap in interest rates between the two countries has nearly vanished.

headline: What is Kick, the platform on which a French streamer died live?
subhead: Raphaël Grave, known online as Jean Pormanove, died Monday during a livestream. The tragedy has shed light on a little-known streaming site and its extremely permissive moderation policies.

headline: In Poland, thousands of young people are spending their 'vacation with the army'
subhead: Launched in 2024, this program drew about 10,000 Poles between the ages of 18 and 35 this summer who, after 27 days of training, have now become reservists in the Polish army.
